abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            unsatisfactory, sustainability unlikely, with only modest
            institutional development impacts. Both the Bank, and
            Borrower performances were unsatisfactory, though mixed,
            given that although the project was responsive to high
            priorities for reform, with a supervision capable of
            redirecting the project as needed, the Bank's delayed
            objections during implementation, lead to an extremely slow
            public procurement process by the Government. Lessons
            reinforce the need for Government commitment during project
            design, and implementation, particularly in assigning
            project managerial responsibilities with political backing,
            and the authority and stature to implement mandates.
            Moreover, appropriate institutional arrangements are crucial
            for managing the reform process, thus reform activities
            should be mainstreamed as of the early stages of the
            project, involving all players, from the highest political
            level, through senior public services management, to the
            professional, and technical levels, with sustained support
            from counterpart Ministries, and Departments. The importance
            of a coherent policy design - and politically supported -
            should be highlighted, for a consistent personnel, and pay
            policy covering all public sector employees, would have
            avoided the conflict - as it so happened - that the gains
            from reducing the size of the civil service, were offset by
            increases in the wage bill for the teachers. Finally, to
            achieve a scheduled procurement, particularly when several
            Ministries or Departments are engaged in project
            implementation, institutional arrangements should be ensured
            for the management of the project, within effective
            structures, and processes.
